website_summaries.verdict: The BoostTurbine 4000 is a reliable gadget charger for when you need extra power, but it's too big to slip into a pocket for everyday use.
pros: The Eton BoostTurbine 4000 charges your dead gadgets quickly and includes a hand crank for extra power
cons: The recessed power button is hard to press and the device is large
At $80, the BoostTurbine is expensive compared with its competition

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn't work (Eton 4000)
customer_reviews.text: I never leave product reviews, unless I'm ecstatic or disappointed. This is the latter. I purchased the Eton hand turbine product a month ago, and have yet to get it to charge anything. It's not like I don't know what I'm doing (I'm an Engineer). I've not torn the device apart and tested the output with a meter yet, but it certainly won't plug-and-play with my iphone 5 at all out of the box. I've contacted support (cservice@etoncorp.com) and had no response after 1 week. Sadly, I would not recommend purchasing products from Eton.
customer_reviews.author: mrodgers

customer_reviews.title: Skip this item.  Failed after six weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Failed after six weeks of use. Everything fine, did a great job and then one day it won't take a charge or dispense one. Apparently I cannot return it to Amazon because it's "Hazardous material", so I'm stuck with a brick and out $90 (price+taxes+shipping)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed. Twice!
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten 2 of these to store kinetic energy and to charge my cell phone on hikes. The first one I got worked for a couple days, then failed. The second one just flat out didn't work. My phone is a Droid Razr Maxx, and works perfectly fine. I have a little USB fan that didn't even move when connected. I wish it worked, but it just did not!
customer_reviews.author: Vince Pike

customer_reviews.title: Best hand crank charger out there.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product. It does exactly what it says. It charges very quickly, and have no issues charging my HTC One M8 multiple times on a single charge. The dynamo works very well but isn't the easiest to crank, but in a dire situation that shouldn't be an issue. Also it's understandably a bit big.
customer_reviews.author: Waltimus

customer_reviews.title: broken after one time use
customer_reviews.text: I charged the battery pack fully and was successful to charge my iPhone 5S. From 80% to 90% around. Then I tried it with my iPad mini. When it was connected, everything looks ok. But when I came back after 10 mins or so, I found the battery pack completely dead. Nothing worked afterward. I re-charged it many hours but nothing happened. No LED, no charging whatever I do. Amazing to see a product broken on the first day. Since, I contacted Amazon and got a refund. I liked the product, design and concept. Feel so sorry it didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hyoun Ju Cho

customer_reviews.title: works as specified
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome, charge from a wall plug first the hand crank works but takes a while to charge. Worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Scherher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item came on time and was just as described, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Mark same

customer_reviews.title: Does not live up to the hype.
customer_reviews.text: I have not been able to get this device to charge anything at all. It looks nice, but fails to live up to the hype. It feels like it should be better quality, and the directions on use are severely Lacking.
customer_reviews.author: E M

customer_reviews.title: Rechargeable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift so not sure how it is working, Fast delivery and came as described. Looked like everything was as described.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: Eton NBOTU4000B
customer_reviews.text: fail to recharge Eton NBOTU4000B Rechargeable USB amazon item can't return to amazon due to hazard material.
customer_reviews.author: Longpham

customer_reviews.title: Great for power outages
customer_reviews.text: I'm keeping this around in our emergency kit for those occasional power outages when I want to keep our mobile phones and other electronic devices charged until the power is restored. I haven't had to use it yet, but did test it and it works exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: LindyLouTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: For someone who is unable to charge their cell phone in the car while traveling, this item serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Meyer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It broke after one use. It will no longer charge from the wall outlet or display the charge status.
customer_reviews.author: Mark McKain

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for Power Outage to Test
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work when it was tested. Have not had a power outage to really test it, which is what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Christensen

customer_reviews.title: I hate it so much
customer_reviews.text: I would give 0, if it would be possible. I bought it and at same day I rolled this thing to charge it and it broke out. I paid $85 for 4000 Mah battery. I hate it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Turmakhanov Abulkhair

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband... He loves it. Not sure he ever uses it, but he keeps it in his bag at all times. He likes the idea that he's always prepared. Lol
customer_reviews.author: jacki

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, but not super portable.
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally engineered piece of equipment. Metal housing, sturdy crank, solid connections, just not something you can very easily throw in the pocket of a pair of shorts if you are heading out for the day (don't forget the cable too). Will charge your phone and someone else gadget nicely. Wish it came with a built in charging cable, and a USB plug. You have to carry unit and cable. The charging level indicator is ok, not great.
customer_reviews.author: listenstobooksincar

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for a friend after another buddy bought one. I like the cranking feature, but it takes a lot of cranking just to get a little charge. It's good that you can plug it in to charge it and I guess if you're out of power you could crank away for hours, but it would take a lot of cranking just to get a good charge. Excellent idea, and it would be even better if we had the technology to improve it.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control?
customer_reviews.text: It worked a couple of times then quit. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's very compact and unintrusive. I've used it several times since I bought it with no problems to report
customer_reviews.author: Osiris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Go Bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! it's not just for the handcrank which generates it's own power but you can have it charged via your computer and take with you when you travel or maybe you are planning on being out all day it's Juice on the go. It's also great for emergencies if power goes out crank it up and get the juice needed.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Fultz of GEFNET

customer_reviews.title: Good to be prepared...
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had a dire emergency yet but we did test this little rechargeable battery and after some work on my husbands part we were able to put 15min on our cell phone. So I suspect with some serious hand crank time we would be fully charged a few items. I have this and a similar emergency radio/flashlight/ in our emergency bug out bag. Considering you can never find batteries when you truly need them I highly recommended this as long as someone has a working arm you have power! Ps...Ambient Weather has a larger selection of versatile similar products there my preference by far.
customer_reviews.author: K-cee Kit

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency power
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for emergency power that won't quit, this is it. The battery is rechargeable via USB, and if it goes flat, simply pull out the crank and add some more. Mind you, there is no way you'd want to crank up a full charge for your cell phone (it would take forever) but a few minutes of cranking will add a few minutes of talk time. Very nice in an emergency. This is largeish and heavy, so you wouldn't want to carry it around in your pocket, but mine lives comfortably in the glove box of my car so I don't ever get caught with a dead cell phone again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo DiBella

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Total junk. If you own an Apple product, it will not charge it. Waste of money. Will not charge any of my family's iPhones or tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Connector broke on second use - useless - hand crank take forever and not practical money wasted
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Eton Rechargeable USB Battery Pack with Hand Turbine Power Generator, Black, NBOTU4000B
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingGive yourself a power boost! BoostTurbine4000 from Eton is a durable back-up battery with a hand turbine power generator that provides power when you need it most. For everyday or emergency use, BoostTurbine4000 enables you to charge your mobile device anytime, anywhere. Fast and efficient, in one minute the hand turbine power generator can produce enough power for about 4 minutes of talk time and a few critical texts. When fully charged, BoostTurbine4000 fully charges most smartphones twice. BoostTurbine4000 is made of tough but lightweight aluminum and with its sleek and elegant design it's compact enough to fit in your pocket. BoostTurbine4000 features a Micro-USB DC input to use with most smartphone chargers and a high output (2.1A) USB port for charging most mobile devices, including tablets. Press button to see LED indicator of battery charge level. BoostTurbine4000 is completely self-contained and it's all you need for an on-the-go-power solution.
feature_bullets: Backup battery pack with rechargeable 4000mAh lithium battery
Fully charges most smartphones twice when fully charged
USB output to charge smartphone or tablet

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.9 out of 5 stars54 ratings2.9 out of 5 stars
